meanings.definition: A person who sharpens razors or knives.
meanings.sent1: The stroppers at the market always keep our knives sharp.
meanings.sent2: I took my dull razor to the stroppers for a quick sharpening.
meanings.sent3: The stroppers had a friendly competition to see who could sharpen the most knives in an hour.
meanings.sent4: She was a stroppers, honing blades with precision like a skilled artist.
meanings.sent5: The stroppers' expertise in sharpening knives was unmatched in the town.

meanings.definition: A device used for sharpening razors or knives.
meanings.sent1: The old stroppers in the kitchen drawer were worn out from years of use.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new stroppers to keep my knives in top condition.
meanings.sent3: The stroppers on the countertop had a vintage charm to it.
meanings.sent4: The stroppers gleamed under the light, ready to sharpen any blade.
meanings.sent5: The electric stroppers made sharpening knives a breeze for the chef.

meanings.definition: A strip of leather or other material used for sharpening razors or knives.
meanings.sent1: The stroppers made of leather were perfect for maintaining the razor's edge.
meanings.sent2: I used the stroppers to keep my knife sharp while camping.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the stroppers were a new toy and played with them.
meanings.sent4: The stroppers felt like a magic wand, transforming dull blades into sharp tools.
meanings.sent5: The stroppers smelled of leather and carried the history of many sharpened knives.
